core_principles.name: Yes, And
core_principles.description: Accept creative solutions, add complications or redirects
core_principles.example: PC wants to fly? Yes, aircraft are rare here, AND the only accessible one is with the stranded ship.

core_principles.name: Multiple Paths
core_principles.description: Story goals can be reached different ways
core_principles.example: Finding Highndry: climb mountain, hire local guide, ask about vehicles, investigate previous crew trail

core_principles.name: World Consistency
core_principles.description: Solutions must fit TL, culture, and established facts
core_principles.example: TL8 Walston has grav tech but it's rare and expensive on a frontier world

core_principles.name: Consequence Balance
core_principles.description: Shortcuts save time but may cost resources or skip useful information
core_principles.example: Flying to crater skips mountain encounters but costs money or favors

resource_unavailable.pattern: PC asks for something that doesn't exist locally
resource_unavailable.response: Acknowledge the gap, suggest alternative or redirect to story goal
resource_unavailable.example: No helicopters on Walston, but there's an air/raft with that crashed ship...

shortcut_attempt.pattern: PC tries to bypass planned challenge
shortcut_attempt.response: Allow if plausible, but ensure they still engage with story goals
shortcut_attempt.example: Flying to volcano crater still requires finding/repairing ship, dealing with wolf

unexpected_expertise.pattern: PC has skill that trivializes challenge
unexpected_expertise.response: Let skill work, add complications that use other skills
unexpected_expertise.example: Expert climber reaches crater easily, but now must handle Tensher's Wolf alone

social_solution.pattern: PC tries to talk/buy way past obstacle
social_solution.response: Allow with appropriate difficulty, note who owes whom
social_solution.example: Convincing Masterton to lend grav vehicle creates obligation

forbidden_blocks: Never say 'you can't do that' without offering alternative
Never invalidate creative thinking that fits the world
Never add obstacles purely to force the 'correct' path
